identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of Free Weight and Machine Training With and Without Aerobic Training Among Body Builders
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Free Weight and Machine Training With and Without Aerobic Training on Strength, Endurance and Muscle Mass of Lower Limb Among Body Builders.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Effects of free weight and machine training with and without aerobic training among body builders.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Effects of free weight and machine training with and without aerobic training on strength, endurance and muscle mass of lower limb among body builders.

armGroups.label: Group A
armGroups.description: 20 participants will be in control group, they will only perform free weight training and machine training and will not perform aerobic exercises
interventionNames: Other: free weight training and machine training

armGroups.label: Group B
armGroups.description: 20 participants will be in experimental group, they will perform aerobic exercises along with free weight training and machine training

interventions.name: free weight training and machine training
interventions.description: 20 participants will be in control group who will only perform free weight and machine training

interventions.name: Aerobic Exercises
interventions.description: 20 participants will be in experimental group giving them aerobic exercise training protocol along with free weight and machine training

primaryOutcomes.description: A 1 Repetition Maximum (1 RM) test is a commonly used method in the fitness and strength training realm to assess an individual's maximum strength for a specific exercise. (18) The test involves determining the maximum amount of weight a person can lift for a single repetition of a given exercise.

The 20-meter multistage shuttle test, also known as the "Beep Test" or "Yo-Yo Test," is a commonly used aerobic fitness test. (20)The test involves continuous running between two lines 20 meters apart in response to audio signals. . If a participant fails to reach the line before the beep, they are given a warning. After a second warning, the test is concluded, and the level reached is recorded.
Measuring muscle size using an inches tape, also known as a tailor's tape or a body tape measure, is a simple and effective way to track changes in muscle size and monitor your fitness progress

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age: - 17-35 years(16)
* Body builders(16)
* Physically fit Athletes (17)
* Male athletes
* Benchmarks for body builders

  1. Minimum 60 kg leg press
  2. Minimum 15 kg hams curl
  3. Minimum 10 kg weighted squats

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participants who will be unable to complete the training
* No musculoskeletal disorder
* No cardiorespiratory disorder
* Jumper's knee
* Any respiratory issue
* Foot and ankle injuries
* Patellar tendinopathy
* Pulmonary disorder
* Ligamentous and meniscal injury
* Bone deformity
* Fractures of lower limb
